page.title: 01N Y Moors, Hasty Bank area
page.content: The area is bisected by a section of the escarpment of the Cleveland Hills which rises steeply from the plain to the north. The lower land i the north of the area has mixed farming with sheep farming predominating on higher areas. The highest land in the area is open moorland with heather and bracken covering. Hill slopes have coniferous-forested areas. Settlement is sparce, being restricted to scattered stonebuilt farmsteads with red pantiled roofs. Farming and forestry provide the only employment. Easy access from nearby industrial Teeside makes the car parkwith seasonal refreshment hut at GR572035 a popular venue from which to explore the area using the many footpaths both through the forsts and over the moors, to which there is open access.
